Content_wSideColumn.Name: Biddulph
Content_wSideColumn.Title: Men's On-Campus Housing
Content_wSideColumn.Abstract: Learn more about on-campus housing at BYU-Idaho for men at Biddulph Hall.

MoveLeft.label: Toggle column right or left (right is default)

Content_wSideColumn.BodyCopy:
Biddulph Hall is non-cooking dormitory-style housing that houses two students in each room with two community bathrooms per hall. Beds are raised off the ground allowing room for storage underneath.  Each room has a mini fridge/freezer and microwave. This style of housing provides a great social scene where students can build  lasting frienships.

Amenities:


  • Two extra-long twin-size (81" long) beds with stilts per bedroom.
  • A mattress cover for each bed.
  • Two closets that can be locked with padlocks if desired.
  • Six drawers beneath each closet.
  • Two desks (with chairs) per room with holes drilled for computer cord.
  • Bulletin board by each desk.
  • Two shelves above each desk.
  • Wastebasket, sink, and mirror in each room.
  • Microfridge® (microwave, small refrigerator/freezer unit).
  • Bathroom facilities on each floor (cleaned every day). Residents do not have to clean them.
  • Vacuums on each floor.
  • TV/VCR/DVD in the main lounge and TV in upper lounge.
  • Ping pong table and pool table in main lounge.
  • Piano in the main lounge and practice room in the basement.
  • Coin-operated laundry facilities on site.
  • Ironing board and iron in laundry room.
  • Kitchenette is available in the basement to make cookies, pizza, and other extras (Not intended to cook meals in.)
  • High speed internet connection in each room directly connected to the university network.
